snippet: John Luther Adams talks about the genesis of “Become Ocean,” to be performed on Tuesday at Carnegie Hall, and other environmentally themed works.
abstract: Corinna da Fonseca-Wollheim notes that composer John Luther Adams will attend his first concert at Carnegie Hall's Stern Auditorium to hear his Pulitzer Prize-winning work Becoming Ocean played there for the first time; observes that while Adams describes piece as inspired partly by his concerns about climate change, he is wary of any attempt to affix literal interpretation to his work.
lead_paragraph: John Luther Adams talks about the genesis of “Become Ocean,” to be performed on Tuesday at Carnegie Hall, and other environmentally themed works.
